org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.scan

Class TestScanOrchestratorEarlySchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.drill.test.BaseTest
      • org.apache.drill.test.DrillTest
        • org.apache.drill.test.SubOperatorTest
          • org.apache.drill.exec.physical.impl.scan.TestScanOrchestratorEarlySchema

  • public class TestScanOrchestratorEarlySchema
extends SubOperatorTest
    Test the early-schema support of the scan orchestrator. "Early schema" refers to the case in which the reader can provide a schema when the reader is opened. Examples: CSV, HBase, MapR-DB binary, JDBC.

    The tests here focus on the scan orchestrator itself; the tests assume that tests for lower-level components have already passed.

      • testTypeSmoothingExplicit

        public void testTypeSmoothingExplicit()
        The projection mechanism provides "type smoothing": null columns prefer the type of previously-seen non-null columns. 
         SELECT a, b ...

 Table 1: (a: BIGINT, b: VARCHAR)
 Table 2: (a: BIGINT)
 Table 3: (b: VARCHAR)
        The result in all cases should be (a : BIGINT, b: VARCHAR)

      • testTypeSmoothing

        public void testTypeSmoothing()
        Test the ability of the scan scanner to "smooth" out schema changes by reusing the type from a previous reader, if known. That is, given three readers:
        (a, b)
        (b)
        (a, b)
        Then the type of column a should be preserved for the second reader that does not include a. This works if a is nullable. If so, a's type will be used for the empty column, rather than the usual nullable int.

        Detailed testing of type matching for "missing" columns is done in #testNullColumnLoader().

        As a side effect, makes sure that two identical tables (in this case, separated by a different table) results in no schema change.

      • testModeSmoothing

        public void testModeSmoothing()

      • testColumnReordering

        public void testColumnReordering()
        Verify that different table column orders are projected into the SELECT order, preserving vectors, so no schema change for column reordering.
